title: Is reading a book using a desk lamp much better for your eyes and causes less eye strain than reading a book on your computer screen or on a Kindle? - Quora

response.answer_text: The most important with any device is : The light must be diffuse.The light must be just measure (not too strong nor too dim).The light must be homogenous.The contrast must be sufficient but not too high.The light must be reddish or yellowish (not much of blue light).The neighbouring might not be be in total darkness.Your reading distance should be around 33 cm.…

My Kindle Paperwhite was designed to be especially easy on the eyes. The screen filters the blue light and is easy on the eyes. I like to read in the dark so the light the Paperwhite gives off is perfect for my needs. I am a longtime book collector and as such, never thought I would want an ereader. I was hooked immediately the first time I turned it on, however. The small size is perfect as it allows me to carry well over 300++ books in the palm of my hand.
